V4d73RTYfc6s8kmLRpK3-Q.text: Blandfords is really great, and a firm favourite in my "work vicinity" for lots of folk here in my office. I've been there a couple of times for breakfast, where they serve incredible baked eggs with chorizo and other deliciousness. You can't go wrong. Mean cups of tea as well, and lovely service.

VhecZwHz0qBHLxxSNWhY5g.text: Very nicely cooked food. The most important thing is the staff there are super friendly!! I also like the atmosphere in the restaurant as well!!

fXGB9LPaYF-jIDWCYkzBrA.text: Lovely place! Excellent friendly service. The pasta was perfect al dente. Brilliant focaccia and great appetiser (avocado vinaigrette or something like that). I'll definitely go back to check the brunch!

ZtFN3AWb9t9nUPwhiMn_1g.text: Wonderful! My 4 friends in I were in town from the States and craving some good Italian. After some research, we decided to walk the 1.5miles to Il Blandford, as it looked like it would be authentic Italian food with great service. We were not disappointed. We got there at 5 after 9, and were told that the kitchen had just closed. After hearing that we walked specifically to eat at their restaurant, the owners said they would reopen the kitchen so we could eat. We were served solives and breadsticks to start, which were quite tasty. Two of us got the gnocchi, one had lasagna, and two had the house special, which was pasta in a cream based sauce with broccoli and potatoes. All of us loved our food couldn't believe how accommodating and friendly everyone was, including one of the other patrons, who offered to give up his seat so we could all sit together. I will absolutely recommend this place to anyone wanting a fantastic restaurant experience in London.

euXZFca55u9SfTDiVe777w.text: I went significantly out of my way to visit this place after reading the rave reviews on here and TripAdvisor, and by jove am I glad I did. The place is so warm and cosy, it feels like you've been invited into the front room of their family home. Then there's the food of course! Great selection, fairly priced. We went for a pizza and a pasta to share and they were both delish. We could easily have left it at that but the waitress tempted us with a slice of homemade carrot cake which we practically inhaled it was so good. This was naturally washed down with some top notch coffee. Like so many good cafes and restaurants in London, seating is limited, but I highly recommend you squeeze yourself in if you can!

sx95JGhPqu1q0Z1-YKMUsw.text: Mmmm...brunch!  I had poached eggs with peppers and other delightful things.  I came here because of the Yelp reviews, and I'm so glad -- it doesn't look particularly inspiring, but the food is delicious and reasonably priced.  Run by friendly Italians, this cozy little diner is a hidden gem for sure.

0gWi4ekf-7NSIZ9WBifb1Q.text: Amazing food, setting and service. Jessica the owner was incredibly friendly and served us the best spanish eggs and freshest juice ever. it has few tables but lovely to sit outside on a summery day Like today. I cannot wait to come back!

WllS45or43MiHcVR-uOdQA.text: Love this little cafe! I went off Yelp and this place came highly recommended. It's an unassuming cafe, with cute but modest decor and seating. The food was great, I love how this place serves an English breakfast without beans, yet was filling and great! I also had their Turkish eggs, which were delicious, with the Greek yogurt and the paprika butter, very creamy and delightful! Their Spanish eggs were also great as well, came out piping hot and was a good dish on a crisp day. Their espresso is really good, no almond milk though, was sad about that. The service was attentive, not overbearing and I never felt rushed.

_DW09ZdUwXyf7VywTnbJ1Q.text: A small cute restaurant with delicious food.  I had the egg focaccia and my fiancée the Spanish eggs.  Everything was cooked to perfection.  Would come back here the next time in London.  It was the best breakfast we had in London.

63qrYYeXoN-o7wS3XZR9vQ.text: I really don't understand all the good reviews on this place. I decided to stop by for breakfast and ordered the poached eggs w/ bacon, avocado and tomato on foccacia bread. The place wasn't too busy, so I was expecting decent service. When ordering, I specifically asked for no tomatoes, as the taste of sliced raw tomatoes truly nauseates me. Lo and behold, when my order comes out, it has tomatoes on it! I stared down dissatisfied at my plate, which cost £9.50 and appeared truly messy- as if it had just been thrown together. Not to mention that instead of the crisp bacon I had been expecting, I was given thick slices of ham. The server looked at me and said "you look like you don't like it! Sorry about the tomatoes." And walked away. If you clearly remember that I didn't order tomatoes, why give them to me? Also, it's worth noting that the portion sizes are WAY smaller than I expected for the price.

dMh5NsdMUjPDnZHFrhbvKA.text: Lovely place!  I yelped this place because it was near our hotel and had good ratings and in our budget. All Italians run the place and lots of Italians coming in and out for coffee or food. Food was great. Fresh squeezed orange juice and smoothies. I had the Spanish eggs which were perfectly savory an my husband has the focaccia which was nice and light.

94e_oYLIPHXi2QF9nP97FQ.text: And old-school diner run by friendly Italians? With breakfast all day?GOOD BREAKFAST?  And a strong Americano under 2pounds? SIGN ME UP. I've bopped past Blandford's several times as its located quite conveniently to my temporary apartment. It's always got at least a few parties perched about eating tasty looking food, and a line at the counter for to-go items...so today I made it the day that Blandford's and I become friends. The name must be a carryover from days of yore, as there is very little chance any of these Italians go by the name "Blandford." However, cheers to them for keeping the history! It also appears many other elements were preserved. The furniture, decor, etc. It's definitely got a retro vibe, in a good way. It's clean as a whistle, though. I was seated promptly, equipped with aforementioned Americano and side of milk and then decided on a veggie omelette (3 eggs!) and one side sausage for good measure and protein. At just 5pounds plus a bit extra on the sausage, I think a deal. All in I was out the door with a VERY filling breakfast for just about 7pounds. The service was friendly, the food hot and freshly prepared...it's got all the basics, and definitely tends toward a more traditional breakfast (think eggs, meats, beans, toasts, and the like), but Italian-influenced lunch specials. They even allow you to bring in your own beer and wine (assuming that's a dinner thing, but hey..perhaps you like a nip with your morning meal?). I'll be a regular.

r0xupSWejsXziyMRC8IsoA.text: A great 'non-sceney' local cafe where you don't need to have your botox up-to-date in order to venture in.  Not fancy, but good solid comfort food with reasonable prices.  The minestrone is good and the homemade lasagna is flavoursome and filling. What they lack in finesse they make up for in endearing Italian hospitality.

UVx9WjVKMk-g3eU0ef8Gug.text: Great lunch spot. Quick, fresh, and delicious. I had a simple spaghetti pomodoro and it was just as good as the more expensive nearby places (really enjoyable!).  I also got a smoothie (which I never get), but it was also great!  I would definitely come back. Free wifi too. Friendly service... Despite the kitchen being closed when I came, they still accommodated my request.

prUOGJLqq2VwoK_XNBbG4w.text: Found that hidden gem thanks to Yelp. It's not obvious because the place is in a small street in a neighbourhood full of restaurants and if you don't know it's there, you will certainly miss it. It feels Italian, it tastes Italian. I had a pizza and an espresso and it was simply delicious. Love it. boom 5 stars, no-brainer

6Fzx4grrrGDZZKgCdF7snQ.text: To be honest, the bright red illy sign was what initially drew me into this petite Italian café; my craving for caffeine simply wouldn't let me skate on past.Once inside, it was apparent that this is a shop that locals frequent. Workmen in uniforms were mowing through hearty breakfast dishes whilst gents in suits popped in for takeaway coffee. The staff jabbered to one another in Italian and more than one visitor tossed a recognisable 'buon giorno' to the servers. Your chances of dining in may be curtailed by the limited seating; there's likely room for only about twenty.And as far as my coffee went, I have no complaints. A simple americano to take away was a mere £1.80 - more affordable than most competitors in Marylebone. Lunch offerings look to be quite traditional Italian fare and certainly worth a followup visit to compare against my visits to Italy!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom. Mixed veg omelette and chips. Because breakfast is served all day here, and chips really do go with everything.

pK5JcRz1QfsqYFFft6kUQw.text: I went to Blandford's for a nice full English breakfast, and I had a lovely morning at the cafe. It seems to be family owned, which I love. Independent restaurants and cafes just seem to be more charming than chains. Or at least I like to think so. When I walked in, one of the sons greeted me and I saw the mother and father chatting away in Italian at a small table in the corner. It was really cute to see the father overseeing his son and I think nephew and kind of guiding/teaching them.I ordered a pot of English breakfast and their full English breakfast, which consisted of toast, ham, two sausage links, a sunny side up egg, mushrooms, and tomatoes. No beans or black pudding though.Service was quick. There were only 4 other people in the restaurant and they only ordered drinks. It's a small establishment, but a good breakfast nonetheless. A little on the pricey side (£10.60 for the tea and breakfast) as there are many more places in London that are cheaper, but I do like to support family businesses.

v0M5c6TTXv4WfjlQBSRI-g.text: When you walk into the restaurant, it is as if you have been trandported to Italy. Everyone is speaking Italian and it feels like you have been invited to eat dinner with la famiglia. It is 100% authentic Italian food that is both delicious and fresh. We had the bruschetta, pasta, freshly juiced apple juice, cappuacino, red wine and pizza.  This place is your ideal niche spot to take your friends and family to mangiare.

qizGc6ud4taptE4eTsGK_Q.text: Excellent Italian food with a really good atmosphere. Specials were very good and everyone enjoyed the wonderful home made food. Highly recommended and can't wait to go back :)

photos.caption: Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom. Homemade Gnocchi with bacon tomato and chilli :)

S5tSRLWbnB1rtLZL_aE7RQ.text: Outstanding.I was traveling for business and I try to hit both the hip places and more local places.  This place has atmosphere and GREAT food.I ordered an American (so good) and the Eggs Florentine (baked eggs over spinach with what must be cream and fresh parmesean).  AMAZING.Owned by an Italian family.  The family members talk lively to each other as well as to the familiar patrons. At one point the waitress was finger pointing and yelling at a patron in Italian.  A minute later they were hugging and laughing.   I was welcomed as I walked in with a Bon Journo! By the end of the meal the daughter who works there   (happened to be my waitress) introduced me to her father and brother.  She asked how I liked the food and told me to come back tomorrow. That we'd be like old friends and she'd confess all of her sins to me.  Not sure I'm ready for that, but I am ready to try another dish there.  This will definately become a regular place for me to visit for bfst when I'm over for work.

nTrcceKHPxk11vTkLs1pww.text: I now find myself detouring and stopping in this place whenever I'm in the area.  What I like the most is that it looks like an old-fashioned "caff", but you find a level of service and quality here that is way beyond anything you'll find in a greasy spoon.  All the people that work here are very responsive and in tune with your needs.  It's a place full of life as well, with family members coming in and out, conversation in the dining area drifting back towards the other staff. It feels very lived in, cosy and homey, and the best part is you're included, in a very appropriate way.  If you want to eat your food and read the paper, no one will bother you.  But if you glance up perhaps because you'd like something else, someone will immediately come over to help you.  It reminds me of being in Italy and that's understandable, because the staff, as far as I can tell, are all Italian.  I recently stopped by and wanted to get something quick and light to eat, and didn't have much time.  I explained this to them, and they immediately suggested some options, and they "got on it."  I ordered a bowl of wonderful vegetable soup, and an avocado-based salad.  At one point the owner saw me adding some salt to the soup, and he asked if I'd prefer to have a bit of grated parmesan cheese, which I did.  After I settled my bill, and as I left, everyone said goodbye.  It's a place you want to come back to.

Tu6aLDTTQ9vaNcrbzuDRZg.text: Very friendly, local, and tasty cafe' serving Italian food and desserts - operated and managed by Italians.  If  you speak  a bit (or a lot) of Italian you can use it here.  The food is fresh, tasty and not expensive.  Staff are really pleasant.  If you are in the neighborhood it's an ideal place to have brunch.  My favorite breakfast dish is the Spanish (baked) eggs, but everything we have had so far has been very good.  The clientele seems to be a good mix of locals, including construction workers in for coffee and eggs, as well as local businesspeople and families.  A nice, local place that makes you feel welcome and serves fresh, tasty food.  A+

Ye5yuVKkEqPDS0p2ML6vSQ.text: After reading some reviews I just had to stop by and try this place. I went for breakfast with a friend and we both decided to go with the eggs - I ordered the Spanish eggs, while my friend went with the Turkish option. Both of our meals were delicious and while I can vouch for that by my own belly, my friend's expression on her face while she was eating obviously shared my opinion. We had some coffee and went on with our day. The place was buzzing at the time of our visit and that may have affected the swiftness of the service but it is all forgiven if they keep up cooking such heavenly eggs.

68T4AMaOjUqUjzx4IbexXw.text: Definitely returning! Our group was looking for a good breakfast spot nearby & Yelp yielded this place as one of the top results. Although the menu may be considered limited to a "typical" breakfast spot, what it did offer was executed extremely well. As for the service? AMAZING! It's a family run cafe & they could not be more accommodating & friendly. 5 stars all around!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom. Cappuccinos, made with Illy coffee.

eOj0mhmB915lTvEB9D7xoA.text: My friend and I had a great brunch at Il Blandford's. What astounded us was the friendliness of the staff. We were greeted and treated super nicely and it really made us want to come back. About the food, we had the eggs florentine, which were very good, and a caramel muffin to die for. We liked that the menu was relatively small, which doesn't leaves too much room for hesitation, but still diverse and interesting enough. Great experience overall, special mention to the staff.

UNtiYK_xpgApYX9a5G74fg.text: Absolutely incredible little "hole in the wall" restaurant! Everything is freshly made; they will even send someone off to the store if they need more of an ingredient immediately! The juices are hand pressed and the meals are all homemade. It is very quaint and cozy and you feel like a real Londoner, even if you are just a tourist for the day! I kept coming back daily, as the food quality was that incredible. The family that owns it is very quiet and you can tell that they take a lot of pride into this restaurant. I would highly recommend this restaurant for any meal of the day!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom

N_xIWrpKhkbrQojwgPI1lQ.text: I only made a quick stop in for a latte, but hope to go back soon. The coffee was lovely and the interior cozy - perfect for a morning coffee and browse through the newspaper.

tBcuoAAdfsTdTWbE9OQaNg.text: What a place for a filling Italian breakfast! This small branch of food heaven has a bit spotty of service and takes a while, but the quality of the food makes up for that and more. I had the Uovo Florentine, which was basically a little metal bowl with poached eggs, cheese, and spinach cooked together inside of it. What a dish, what a dish...

3R6vUdEjopAgUuu_twPWcw.text: Found this gem. Was just going to have a coffee but decided to try the breakfast. So pleased I did. It was amazing. Lovely atmosphere. Staff all very friendly. I thought I was back in Italy when I walked in as they spoke to me in Italian :) very nice touch. Shame I live 5 hours away but I will return. Thank you for such a memorable experience.

dNJCTn1vNRzDfM9xLArGfQ.text: We had a late lunch, great pizza and minestrone soup, fresh chicken salad. Felt like Italy ! Family atmosphere and kind service, would definitely come back. Highly recomended

daosJzIkxP3peruAqWNp9Q.text: My wife and I are traveling through London with our good friends and came across this amazing cafe. Phenomenal food! I can honestly say that it was the best breakfast meal I have ever eaten. I recommend the Spanish omelette. On top of that, probably the BEST customer service one could experience. The owner and his family made me feel like a close family relative. Highly recommended.

dk5KSEt13w8TKbmfSPcyPQ.text: I basically stumbled into this place during a family vacation in London. It was far and away the best meal we had on our trip. Fantastic pasta bolognese with fresh noodles that were perfectly cooked, and utterly perfect minestrone soup exploding with vegetables and subtle flavors.Jessica, the young Italian emigre owner, managed to exude a combination of efficiency and warmth that was great! She actually harangued me to finish my pasta because they don't like wasting food and they're serving it with love, goddamit! I also had a very nice chat with her father, an emigre from Sicily by way of New York. This was a great refuge on a cold, rainy afternoon. We will definitely be back on our next trip to London, and probably for more than just one meal next time.

NPA6uozq1ZW0AU3u80ED4A.text: This is the kind of quaint, authentic Italian diner you see in movies. The brunch dishes are spectacular, with friendly service to boot. While I was eating, another patron complimented the hostess on the food, and she in turn invited him to look into the kitchen and see the grittle -- as that is the key to all the delicious meals. It's the perfect little place to pop into with friends or on your own for a quality Italian brunch experience against the soundtrack of Italian being rapidly spoken and the delicious smells from both the coffee (illy) and the dishes. If I lived in the area, I would definitely become a regular. The only reason I give 4/5 stars is because there is a pretty high minimum for card payments.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom

ucsKJIHAPXS-RgGXgIsI3g.text: Memorandum to self: next time you want to: start a business in the black market, or plan the theft of crown jewels, come here, sit at one of the wooden booths on the wall, and share your thoughts in strict italian while drinking coffee.This is the kind of places you would see in the godfather goodfellas, just pure italian magic directly in the hearth of London. Me and my lady had breakfast here, and we were truly satisfied by it: generous portions, nice and hearty flavors (maybe a little bit too spicy, but it really depends on what you order!). Coffee is illy, and that's guarantee of quality, and try the croissant, buttery and mouth watering.Put away your phone, come here and just enjoy this place, coming straight from the past. This is just how an italian caffe' should be. Thanks Blandfords for being what you are!

E4G94V3XxPSCeTi6uSCImA.text: Blandfords is a shining beacon of good taste amidst the banality of Baker Street. Here are all the things I love about it:- The Italian owners greet you with a friendly Bongiorno! when you walk in- A grandfatherly figure sits in the corner, sipping cappuccino and correcting the people (maybe his younger family members?) as they make coffee- Booths beside big windows with tons of natural light- The food! Their focaccia breakfast is a fantastic Italian take on the great British/American breakfast tradition: poached eggs on foccacia toast smothered in olive oil so fresh you can taste the olives... served with slices of remarkably-fresh tasting tomatoes and avocado and bacon for some salty goodness. It's poetry, my friends. Seriously, you should drop what you're doing and go have breakfast here now.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom. What a breakfast treat: the foccacia with a flat white

LZ9-PJxsBEW6psf_D3Mi7g.text: Cutest and coziest little cafe on Chiltern! Went for brunch, got the eggs focaccia and subbed bacon for caramelized onions, friend got the ovo florentine. Both were amazing!! Will be back soon

F14_FRTzrsQALMIimYoPww.text: One of my favorite place in Marylebone! Love this family and all the food! Thank you!

5JDvWXIr0CYxy8sGiB9fdQ.text: I'm still in the restaurant and already writing a review. The Spanish Eggs are the breakfast of Gods. Perfect mixture of spicy and sweet - the cheese is just right. Hands down the best I've ever had and blows other brunches out of the water. Service is spot on. I'm definitely coming back!

i-3l9u8bY6HyhyS66b-NKQ.text: We chose the restaurant because of the positive reviews on this site.  We were obviously not the right fit for this restaurant.  We had almost two hours to eat lunch before catching a train.  After sitting for 30 minutes waiting for someone to take our order, we started to get nervous about time and got up to leave.  The owner quickly and loudly made a scene asking us to stay, so we sat back down.  We should have trusted our gut and left.  When we told her we had limited time because we had to catch a train, she said "I don't work on train time".  We ordered a few pizzas because she indicated that they would be quick.  25 minutes later the pizzas come out.  We could hear her complaining about us to a gentleman at the next table, saying that we didn't appreciate a nice restaurant.  When we left, I thanked her for accommodating our time schedule.  She scolded me for taking up her "best table" and not staying to order enough food.  The food wasn't that great and the service was lousy.  I wouldn't go unless you have 2+ hours for lunch and planning on becoming a "regular".

jDMxhsWcPKdfI7K9mdqo9A.text: Quaint little nook that is great for chilling with friends and family. We just got coffees and the tiramisu, all of which were great.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom. An Illy cappuccino, also very good.
Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom. Yummy tiramisu

xZj9nVog4i3hmf6h7ItQSg.text: Really lovely service here. I think the other elite reviews are spot on - this feels like a solid neighbourhood haunt - good value and excellent food! Love that they do all-day breakfast on weekends and also serve a regular Italian menu. The cosy tables encourage conversation with those around you and you can take a peek at what they all order to help you pick. The poached eggs in yoghurt and paprika sauce were sublime!

2u3jHZDGfh-yuBa5qOQATw.text: After a hectic morning of shopping, I was in desperate need of some hearty brunch fare and a strong coffee. A quick search on yelp brought me to Il Blandfords- and my goodness was I pleased!Fantastic customer service from the mostly, if not all, Italian team who made us feel right at home. The breakfast menu which is served all day had several tantalising options, but I was drawn to the Spanish Eggs, baked eggs in tomato sauce with piquillo peppers, olives, chorizo, jamon Iberico and cheese (well I added the cheese because why not?). Oh...em...gee!My dish arrived hot and bubbly, with still runny yolks dancing in a sea of perfectly seasoned sauce. The chorizo and jamon have the dish a salty kick, while the buttered white toast provided the perfect vessel for sopping up every last bite.Honestly- it tasted like a well made classic pizza- but for breakfast, and with eggs. Just, wow. Perfect americano as well.I'll be back, especially as the dinner menu is packed with classic pasta dishes- and you can bring a bottle of wine?! I'm all in!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom. Strong black americano- molto buono!
Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom. Spanish eggs

Ed-qTT6YMBMGkGQmKq4LqQ.text: Not sure why I love this place so much, but it really feels cosy, family oriented, relaxed and 'authentic'...oh wait a minute, yup, I remembered why I like this place so much, it's because it feels cosy, family oriented, relaxed and 'authentic'.I used the word 'authentic', but I suppose the fact that really Italian Italians run this place and they serve food (talking mainly about breakfasts here) that is quintessentially British, is a bit misleading. But it feels right, it feels good and it feels welcoming.Bon Giorno! Usual greeting on entering, and you'll see that the British grub does, somehow, manage to have a bit of an Italian touch too. The coffee is freshly milled and tastes great, so much better than the chains on Baker Street, why didn't I come here sooner?!The seating area is a little limited, but if you can get a seat, cherish it, you'll be fed well, given great service and it won;t cost you the earth.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom. Focaccia breakfast!
Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom. Turkish eggs, devine
Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom. Inside

YmAU0K3iKG2vmdlPoTvR6g.text: Small, friendly place. The service is super friendly, food is good (not the fastest though) and coffee is great! Prices are pretty fair for London. One of the few places in London that is still managed by the owner and does not belong to a bigger chain!Reservations recommended.

5aPiZhdwWvAS_9atg93Xmw.text: I came here once with a friend and we had a really lovely experience.  The wait staff was friendly (yet at times a bit slow with attending to us), we got a table by the window and ordered some of the better pizza we've had since moving to London.  The prices are very reasonable, the pizza is delicious, and if you're really hungry, the bruschetta is worth ordering.  The only problem was I was so full that I only could eat half of my pizza, which seemed to disappoint the maitre d, assuming I didn't like it.  But they gave me a box so I could enjoy it the next day.  All in all, a great find!

JB7lHY_O3erOsj9W7nTk9w.text: The story goes like this:I finished work earlier than usual one day and found myself waiting on the little lady to finish work in the Baker Street area. I have been eyeing up Blandfords Cafe for a while (not physically, mind you, that would be creepy, because cyber stalking is so much more acceptable). I headed straight over and walked in tentatively, and was suprised that even at the odd timing, a few of the tables were occupied, a gentleman facing the street had just received his fragrant pizza, whilst the majority were enjoying their coffees.I was a man on a mission, so my first question was whether or not they would serve their spanish eggs on their breakfast menu despite it being mid-afternoon. After a quick check with the kitchen, they were happy to oblige. I ordered that and a latte.The latte was suprisingly good, the ground coffee was at the bottom of the glass, but all in all, it was a very decent coffee, it would beat your starbucks or costa anyday of the week. The spanish eggs came first (the toast was to follow), but I couldn't wait to dig in, so I broke into one of the runny eggs, and worked the yolk into the tomato sauce, peppers, onions, ham and salami/chorizo(?). It worked, the ingredients were simple and the meat was good, but not top-notch. But damn, it worked. The flavours were bright and more-ish, even without the bread to soak it all up, I happily ate a few spoonfuls, when the toast came, it only topped off the experience in style. I lapped up everything onto the toast and it was absolutely delightful. I want to come here for breakfast everyday. It is a tad steep, but I enjoyed myself thoroughly.

Mgex1HSuw2OVX-JOYRZX2g.text: This place is just flipping awesome! We came here as a group for a late lunch today and they had room for us. We basically all got their special: gnocchi with tomato, bacon and chili. It was DELICIOUS! As my colleague said 'I could sit there all day with a glass of wine and watch the world go by'. This place is a hidden gem and I love it. Want to go back immediately to try everything else!

3cMMW54dSHf4zNnkekUQRg.text: Blandfords café - or, as their business card puts it - IL Blandford is a small traditional-looking place in right off Baker St. As you will appreciate on the menu and from the overall quality of coffee, one can tell this place is really Italian. More precisely, Sicilian. Service is as you would expect it from an Italian-managed place: highly personalized, fairly loud and straight-forward. The lunch menu is the real deal. The manager here puts lots of attention on food freshness and appearance, so this is the place to come if you want a real meal with an eye to detail, or a quiet late breakfast on weekdays. They also serve great pizzas. Down sides: dishes are pretty pricey for their size, it gets packed at lunch time, they don't accept credit cards (yet).

4oz5dNnVM3iqcxiVn4F3EA.text: We came here once for a good brunch place, and we are going back today! This place is really awesome, especially the Spanish eggs. Look below for some pictures from other reviewers. It is a quaint little Italian restaurant with very nice owners. Seating is limited, so it can be busy at times. When we went around 11 AM or so, we were seated quite quickly. One thing though, I do not recommend getting the smoothies or juices. For some reason, they tasted bland, as if watered down. Other than that, we had a wonderful experiences here including great services from the waiters!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom. Traditional English breakfast, delicious!

wQvwhJlqTRwR86WRxebnKw.text: Small spot just off Paddington;  come Twitter ve and loved our meals both times.  Avocados to start with were great.  The soups are nice and healthy,  pizza tasty,  could use more sauce,  but I'm pretty picky.   And they make a good cup of Ily coffee.  Affordable and family owed.

Cmjx7iPs763MtF6MwjGwcQ.text: One of the best tiramisus i've ever had. Took the gnocchi,  incredible taste but a bit overcooked. Good service, nice location. Very cosy

v_vbXlD50Pw5q0LzHkDjfw.text: A small cosy place, there are many options there, we ordered pizza with rucola for sharing It was very delicious.Lasagna, pasta with white creamy sauceBreaded veal and chicken with mushroom sauceThe foods portion is Generously enough Perfectly cooked, in general the food was amazing With reasonable price, we really enjoyed!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom. Yumm
Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom. Amazing lasagna

mSLXNEaxfEuQf0Vk5LBAMQ.text: What can I say about Blandford except I have raved about it to everyone I know. They are a small Italian, family run cafe, they have amazing breakfast and are super friendly and nice. I go to Blandford once a month on average for brunch, and that is quite a compliment given the abundance of brunch options in central London. While I can't speak for their non-brunch items, which I am sure are fantastic (pizza, pasta, lasagna etc.), I can tell you that they make some of the best eggs I've ever had. Turkish eggs, Eggs Florentine, Spanish Eggs, all amazing!!! And oh the Orange juice there is phenomenal. It is worth just going for that. Real freshly squeezed, sweet orange juice. Yum!!

mJXUw_3QlW-LKorN99mA9w.text: This is like going home to Mama for an great home cooked meal done with love and care. The warmth of the staff makes you think you have gone to the corner spot in the village where you are always welcomed and the toils of the daily life will be part of the conversation. Now the food!!! I have to say I am still looking for what I did not like and failing every time. The pizza is sublime like what you get in Napoli. The Burrata is not to be missed. But if ever they have the calamari on the menu, grab and have it any which way your heart desire. It is sure to delight. The vegetarian choices also abound. And this is not limited to pizza and pasta. The carnivores mains are amazing. I am walking my way down the list but somehow I am always distracted by the specials. I also keep spying other people's dishes and I want even when I am so satisfied that not a morsel could pass my lips. Of course they have deserts and  if like me not another bite could be had, there is affogado. For the unfamiliar that is ice cream in coffee and man that hits the spot. The Barista will cure you of any further satisfying trips to Starbucks and the likes. Now one warning the place is small so make sure you either send an email to book or go early. And please do not ever waste the table!But bonus, they serve breakfast. And for those like me who tire of a good old English Breakfast, imagine stuffed Italian croissant with cream with a great double expresso. Brings me back to Milan. So if you can work your way past the throngs of tourists on Bakker Street and go see the team at Il Blandford's and you will be transported to a little place in heaven for a few hours.

yh2Iy75fxi9gEayGm5MrbA.text: I think I'd give this 3.5 stars if I had that option. It's small and cosy and fairly simple inside but pleasant. It was really quiet when we went on a Saturday night but it was also eurovision night!We shared a burrata salad with cherry tomatoes and rocket to start. Burrata was super fresh and the tomatoes were tasty but it was lacking a little bit of flavour. Needed some salt or balsamic vinegar.We then shared a pizza and a gnocchi dish. Both were good but nothing amazing. I enjoyed them but my local Italian is better.However to be fair it is really cheap. Starter was 10 and each main was 10 so great value. Would go back if I was in the area but wouldn't make a special trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom. Gnocchi with fior di latte
Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom. Vegetariana pizza
Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom. Burrata salad - the cheese was really fresh but it did need a little more flavour.

o7RD39lbPpDC2doPql2K_A.text: Perfect coffee and breakfast in an Italian way! Nice staff and cosy place. Very nice breakfast!  sit by the window and people by drinking your coffee.  Try the mixed juice!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom. Mmm
Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom

hwY-8RdxpNoNE4mKNadnqg.text: Very nice! Excellent pizza. Casual atmosphere. Family run or at least it feels this way. Will come again and again.

ysf2uIgGDEm03SkFV02NUQ.text: First visit was a chance, second my hands down choice. Love this small, intimate place that I have only been for lunch and dinner. The agnolotti with truffle and cream made me return, the linguini with clams will make me return again. They owner is a fab, contagious Italian that believes food is life. Hate to even share, always want a seat when I get to London.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom

W461_obWqFDUsnoEwqYwIQ.text: I found this little authentic Italian restaurant while searching for a nice place to eat lunch while catching up with an old friend. It has really good reviews on numerous web sites, and we weren't disappointed. The quality and taste of the dishes we ordered were right up there with other 4 & 5-star places. It is a smaller restaurant, however, and the seating inside was a little cramped, but we really enjoyed our meal and wine and visit with good friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom

yzCYG1WNxfzYTIf5reGAKg.text: This was a pleasant surprise! I work just around the corner and have passed by Blandfords numerous times before finally stopping in with some colleagues the other afternoon. There are only a few tables and chairs, and the decor isn't anything to write home about, but damn if they don't bring it with the service and food!We had a table, menus, and a waiter taking drink orders in less than two minutes. Water all around, and an appetizer to share a few minutes later. They serve the "made with love by someone's nana" Italian. Very simple, no fuss, straight up delicious Italian. I had a gnocchi with a spicy tomato sauce, veggies and just the right amount of parmesan. Everyone in our group ordered something different and we ate in silence aside from the "man....mmmm....this is gooooood"s coming from around the table. Can't believe people head to Strada on Baker Street when this is right around the corner. I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom

9l6wtQFiWVFcNEVLbwCX9A.text: Very nice Italian home food , authentic family business .. Cosy they ofer fresh squeezed juices , they serve illy coffee which is one of the best.they where welling to do my scaloppine lemoni which is not in the menu Really love the placeWill defiantly  come again

I0yf020Z46R0YW7pis-f5g.text: Great dinner ! Found the place by chance but the ratings here confirm the experience. Very friendly staff. Good Italian cooking and reasonably priced.

gfvt40JRTYK-DA0c31XJ4g.text: If you are in the Marylebone and Baker Street area, and if you fancy a quick and tasty meal (breakfast or lunch). You can't go far wrong with this place, I have been here a few times and I was never disappointed with either the service nor the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom. Pizza

Px0bQ2QHFq0pXR6YyDsz8Q.text: Small, cozy, cute. Delicious breakfast (both spanish eggs and salmon focaccia were fabulous) and delectable americanos. Attentive, personable service.

38k5-50Juhu-aNu_n7uEaw.text: We had breakfast at this lovely family restaurant on a Sunday and it was amazing. Good coffee, a lovely English breakfast...but the real star of this meal was the eggs Florentine - eggs with spinach and cheese, smothered in béchamel. So very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom. Full English breakfast, eggs Florentine in the background.
Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Florentine. So good!

afmhffCTTOddBaREtxxiNQ.text: I read Elliot A's review about this place and it made me come here the very next day. Truth be told, I've been walking by this place everyday for the past 1.5 years on my way to work, but I didn't feel drawn to it for some reason. Which is strange, as I'd seen it written up in Independent London and elsewhere as one of the local spots in London. I guess what didn't really attract me was the rather non-inspiring display of food in the counter; they use it more as a storage place than as a selling counter. So I went here and what I found is that this place is all about substance over style - and not the reverse. While the counter may not hold attractive stuff, what comes out of the kitchen is spot on and makes both my belly and my mind very happy. I can, at this point, only vouch for the breakfasts, but I will soon try their pizza - must be a winner as this place is run by true Italians!But Blandford's Café really had won me over when I walked by it in the evening of the very same day that I had breakfast there. As I walked by, the owner's daughter waved at me. This was the call to action and the action would be to come back here as they want me to come back. It felt like family! I have since been back a couple times and every time I'm impressed at the great hospitality. It really seems that the majority of the people coming here is regulars as the staff greets them like this: "The usual?" or "Are you sure you don't want the Spanish Eggs today?" or "I haven't seen you in a while."

photos.caption: Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom. Made with Italian love!
Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom. Spanish Eggs...a big hit amongst the regulars

JCUzr85EPoKjxaAVSkZZTQ.text: I've walked by Il Blandfords Cafe many times living in the neighborhood and I finally decided to give it a try for lunch - and I'm glad I did!Food: They have great menus for breakfast, lunch and dinner.  I've been craving a good pizza and was happy to see that they had a few on the menu.  I ordered the Diavola pizza and was told it was proper size for one person.  It came out and was much bigger than I expected but that didn't stop me from eating ALL. OF. IT because it was sooooo delicious.Drinks: I ordered a soft drink.Price: 9.70 GBP for one person for lunch.  Ambiance: I sat outside because I had my dog with me.  The inside looks very cozy.Service: The service was friendly and attentive.Would I go back?  Yes!  I can't wait to try their breakfast.  This is a strong contender of being on my go to list in the neighborhood.  Note: They don't take credit cards, only cash.  There are two banks down the block from the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom

LyyonAz__B8ugQFCenn7VQ.text: The pizza was really good. If u get the latte, don't forget to add sugar. Spaghetti Bolognese was exceptional. We were in London (family if 4 with kids) for Spring break, and glad we found this place.  All in all it was really good.

Gt1CRNGqYr7RzZPU4G1QAg.text: One of the best Italian restaurant I've ever been to. Very good food, not expensive at that, and the owner will do her best to offer the best wine to go along with your choice of pasta or pizza. Really good. Go there and see for yourself. The place is small, though, so either book in advance, or in couples.

vJLcpxr0IIX5CiwY7rPCSw.text: This little Italian café is a real gem. In Marylebone, there are few decent budget options, and what few there are are mostly chains. This place is a diamond in the rough for the budget-conscious of this pricey central London neighbourhood!Il Blandford (there is some confusion about the name, it shows up as The Blandford, Blandford's, Il Blandford, and various others in different sources) serves up English breakfasts and Italian fare (including pizzas, pasta and the like).I've been twice for breakfast, and both times were excellent. All the servers are really fun, interesting, and personable -- without the service feeling invasive. The space is small and cozy, without feeling cramped. And the food is tasty and satisfying, but light enough to enjoy fairly regularly. The English breakfast (which you might not expect to find in such an overtly Italian themed spot) is really fantastic.A special spot in Marylebone and if you're there, there's a good chance you'll spot me!

4crhV37WxqubGiuXSLpK-w.text: Amazing, authentic, fresh, homemade Italian food! So good we are back again today!!! The lasagna is amazing, but the pizza is too...nothing beats the genuinely welcoming staff as well!This cute cozy cafe is very popular and for good reasons...come for breakfast or for an early or late lunch! It's worth it :)

photos.caption: Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom. After meal chocolate espresso drink...so good and really gave us a boost of energy after eating those carbs :)
Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom. Lasagna in bolognese sauce...I could have had two of these!
Photo of Il Blandford's - London, United Kingdom. Homemade fresh pesto gnocchi (wasn't on the menu when I came but they made it for me anyway) so delicious!
